intro: Aiphanes acaulis, commonly known as the tree fern, is a member of the Arecaceae family and is native to South America. It is a tall, slender plant that can grow up to 10 meters in height, characterized by its large, pinnate fronds. The plant has a distinctive trunk that is covered in fibrous, leaf-like sheaths, which are remnants of old fronds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Aiphanes acaulis plays an important ecological role by providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
